Key Arguments: The bill makes dangerous assumptions that could undermine individual responsibility.
It infringes on free speech and the right to form personal opinions.
Exemptions for government and professional media indicate control and ignorance.
The bill assumes that government and media are infallible, which is unrealistic.
The bill could lead to authoritarianism in Australia.
Notable Quotes: This bill impinges on our right to free speech and also our right to decide what we think about what is presented to us.
Authoritarianism is not a good look for Australia.
